title: Cat. 39  Sugar Urn and Cream Pot, c. 1793
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Daniel Van Voorhis (American, 1751–1824)  
New York, New York  
Silver; cream pot: 18.7 × 5.7 × 14 cm (7 3/8 × 2 1/4 × 5 1/2 in.); covered sugar urn: 24.1 × 10.2 × 10.2 cm (9 1/2 × 4 × 4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society through Mrs. Cyrus H. Adams and Mrs. James C. Hutchins, Jr., 1950.1648.1–3

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom (fig. 39.1)

Engraved at center on front of each: R. B. M. N.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With White Elephant Shop, Children’s Memorial Hospital, Chicago, 1950.

Given by the Antiquarian Society through Mrs. Cyrus H. Adams and Mrs. James C. Hutchins, Jr., to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1950.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Milwaukee Art Institute, Tradition of American Silver, February 13–March 9, 1953, cats. 38–39.

Art Institute of Chicago, The Antiquarian Society: The First One Hundred Years, April 23–June 19, 1977, cat. 199 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Art Institute of Chicago (1951), cats. 58b–c (ill.).

Rogers (1958), p. 55 (ill.).

McClinton (1968), p. 17 (ill.).

Osborne (1975), p. 743 (ill.).

Tvrdik (1977), cat. 199.

Naeve (1978a), p. 21 (ill.).

Pulos (1983a), p. 43 (ill.).

Barter et al. (1998), pp. 112–13, cat. 41 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Sugar Urn and Cream Pot, c. 1793.

fig. 39.1 </section>
